entry.title: Integration of Joule with IAS for SAP SuccessFactors and S4 HANA: Procedure and Impact
entry.content:
We have integrated Joule with IAS, which is linked to S4 HANA. Can we also link the same Joule service with the IAS of SAP SuccessFactors? Additionally, we have two IAS instances: one for SAP SuccessFactors and another for S4 HANA.

Could you please provide the procedure if this integration is possible? If not, what alternatives do we have?

What will be the impact on the systems and data in both scenarios?

entry.title: Joule error in S4HC public when accessing SAC: No access to service
entry.content:
Dear all,

I'm currently testing Joule in a Partner TDD S4HANA Cloud public system... and since the Analytical insights feature seems now generally available I wanted to try this out by using SAC as source, as well.

My SAC system is also TDD, so it has already Version: 2025.8.3 - I know that the regular SAC Q2 update will come on the weekend May 17/18. So a regular SAC tenant might not yet work as of today.

I could include the SAC system successfully into the formation like described here.

My user settings in S4HC are in English, and my question is posted in English as well, since this is currently a prerequisite.

All 3 systems: S4HC, Joule and SAC use the same Identity Authentication Service, and I myself am system owner in SAC, so I have full authorization. We have a Import model indexed via Just Ask, and questions & answers there work fine.

But when using Joule the following error message appears:

Based on this response, it looks like Joule "knows" that it should access the SAC tenant, but obviously the login does not work 😞

My question is: Why not? What is the trick?

My assumption is, the root cause is lying somehow in the login procedure... but when I check in SAC: System - Administration - App Integration, I can see:

- One managed OAUTH Client: JOULE_OAUTH_CLIENT_etc_etc...

- One Trusted Identity Provider: JOULE_IDP_etc_etc...

So I would assume there is a working server to server communication?

FYI: Login into our SAC via the IDP is done via the specific SAML Attribute: User ID, which is also stored in the IDP User ID (If I would store the e-mail address there, I could no longer log into SAC. However mail address is used as Fallback method - without positive effect for my issue). The S4HC User of course is not aware of this. There we have the e-mail address, we have the HR ID P0000xx and we have a CB9980000xx auto-generated User ID.

Is anybody in the community here facing the same problem?

Or who is already able to use Joule with SAC results... and how is your SAC login configured?

Thanks for any feedback.

BR, Martin

Joule

I've already checked that both the joule and Sales and Service Cloud system use the Default Identity Provider: Identity Authentication in CIS (cloud identity services)

If anyone has any ideas, please let me know 😉

Kind Regards

entry.title: Learn BTP, Joule, and AI – as SAP Business Analyst or a Consultant
entry.content:
Hi SAP Community,

I’ve worked as an SAP FICO Consultant and am currently in a SAP Business Analyst role. I'm looking to build hands-on knowledge of SAP BTP, AI capabilities, and low-code tools so I can support digital transformation initiatives more effectively. I'm particularly interested in:

  • Exploring AI/ML use cases using SAP Joule and SAP AI Core, especially in business processes
  • Learning about workflow automation and low-code/no-code tools
  • Gaining insights from SAP Data sphere or SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC) for data-driven decisions
  • Understanding how SAP Build (apps, process automation, work zone) and SAP CAP can be applied functionally
  • Understanding integration concepts across SAP systems and BTP

Could the community please guide me on:

  • Recommended learning journeys or certifications 
  • Practical use cases or examples 
  • Resources, blogs, or sandbox environments to practice and explore hands-on

Any guidance would be really appreciated. Thank you!

Regards,
Priyanka

entry.title: Joule answers in eclipse
entry.content:
What is the best way to deal with wrong answers from joule?

I have asked for a program to write table entries to a transport. It is not bad, but it has a few bugs. e.g. a function module is proposed that does not exist.

After I wrote that it does not exist, another one was suggested to me that does not exist.

I could simply change the program and use it, which would be much faster than if I created it myself. But perhaps I could get a correct answer in the future with a few prompts? At the moment, however, this takes longer than correcting it in the coding.

entry.title: How to use SAP Joule in Non SAP Applications
entry.content: We are exploring the use of Joule within our non-SAP application. Could anyone please explain the integration process? Specifically, is there an API available that allows us to consume Joule services directly in our application, without relying on SAP Datasphere?

entry.title: Issue with Destination Visibility in Cloud Identity Services – Connectivity Plan Required or Workaro
entry.content:
We are currently facing an issue when attempting to create a Source System in the Identity Provisioning Service. Specifically, the destination we've configured in our SAP BTP subaccount isn't appearing as an option in Cloud Identity Services. Based on our research, it seems we may need to create a Cloud Identity Services Connectivity Plan within the same subaccount, as suggested by this community thread: https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-q-a/no-destination-available-at-identity-provisioning-service/qaq-p/12609309.

We have been following this comprehensive guide to enable Joule capabilities for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition: https://community.sap.com/t5/enterprise-resource-planning-blog-posts-by-sap/joule-for-sap-s-4hana-cloud-private-edition-a-comprehensive-setup-guide/ba-p/13786453.

However, we encountered an error while trying to create this Connectivity Plan, matching the scenario described in SAP Knowledge Base Article 3462424: https://userapps.support.sap.com/sap/support/knowledge/en/3462424.

Could the absence of this Connectivity Plan indeed be the root cause of our issue, or is there an alternative workaround available that would allow the already-created BTP destination to appear within the Cloud Identity Services? Any insights or guidance from the community would be greatly appreciated.

entry.title: What's the future of SAP technical consultant?
entry.content:
With the introduction of next-generation technologies like SAP BTP, ABAP RESTful Application Programming Model (RAP), SAP Build (LCNC tools), and SAP Joule (AI), it's clear that SAP is moving towards a clean core, cloud-based future.

However, in reality, many organizations are still operating on legacy ABAP systems, and real-world adoption of these new tools remains limited. With the end of ECC support by 2027, this gap raises some concerns.

❓Key Questions:

1. What is the realistic future for SAP technical consultants in this evolving landscape?

2. Is it practical to invest time in RAP, BTP, or AI tools, given the current slow adoption?

3. Are any real projects or clients actively implementing these technologies?

Would appreciate insights from those currently working on RAP or BTP-based projects or involved in modern SAP implementations.

Thank you!

entry.title: Unable to Access External Services from SAP Build Code-Based Fiori App
entry.content:
I have developed a Fiori application using SAP Build Code which primarily handles the frontend. The application is deployed in my SAP BTP subaccount and is functioning correctly from the UI perspective.

However, when attempting to integrate external services—specifically backend services that are already deployed in the same BTP subaccount—those services are not visible or accessible in the application. I have confirmed that:

 

  • The backend services are successfully deployed and running.

  • The destinations are configured correctly in BTP Cockpit.

However, suddenly it stopped executing these features, saying it cannot connect to my system.All destinations are correct, the identity propagation is as well, the services are active, and the user has permission; I have no idea what it could be

entry.content:

When running the Joule Booster, I get this error:

I've followed the given link (Register an SAP S/4HANA Cloud System in a Global Account in SAP BTP | SAP Help Portal) to register S/4HANA in BTP. However, when I go to System in BTP and choose to get a token, I don't see the "Integration with Joule" communication scenario group mentioned:

Any idea what I'm I missing in BTP to get this group?

Thanks in advance.
